Uses of Package
org.protune.core

Packages that use org.protune.core
org.protune.api Under the architectural point of view, one of the main features of the Protune system is its mix between imperative and declarative components. 
org.protune.core Package org.protune.core provides the core classes of the Protune system. 
 

Classes in org.protune.core used by org.protune.api
DummyTerminationAlgorithm
          Dummy implementation of the interface TerminationAlgorithm, which terminates if the other Peer sent the same filtered policy as before and no further (reliable) notifications.
NegotiationElement
          As stated in Status, a negotiation state should contain (at least) sent/received FilteredPolicy Notification of performed actions Check testing whether the notifications are (not) reliable When inserted into a state, such entities are decorated with other information which are meant to support advanced features.
TerminationAlgorithm
          At each negotiation step the current peer should decide whether going on or stopping the negotiation, based on the current value of the negotiation state.
 

Classes in org.protune.core used by org.protune.core
ActionSelectionFunction
          NOTE: The signature of the method ActionSelectionFunction.selectActions(Action[], Status) should most likely be changed.
Checker
          The interface Checker provides methods for checking whether a notification is (not) reliable, i.e. whether an action, which is supposed to be executed, was actually executed as reported in its notification.
FilterEngine
          The objects of the classes implementing the interface FilterEngine carry out every activity related to the filtering process of a policy.
NegotiationElement
          As stated in Status, a negotiation state should contain (at least) sent/received FilteredPolicy Notification of performed actions Check testing whether the notifications are (not) reliable When inserted into a state, such entities are decorated with other information which are meant to support advanced features.
ProtuneFilterEngine
          NOTE: This class is still work in progress.
Status
          The interface Status represents the state of a negotiation.
TerminationAlgorithm
          At each negotiation step the current peer should decide whether going on or stopping the negotiation, based on the current value of the negotiation state.
UnknownNotificationException
          The exception UnknownNotificationException is meant to be thrown by one of the methods of (one of the implementations of) the interface Checker when the checker is unable to handle some notification type.
